summary.subject: Call for Papers: International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE) 2026 Research Track
summary.overview: The ICSE conference is a prominent forum for discussing significant technical research contributions in software engineering. The research track invites submissions of original and unpublished results.

important_information.details: From 2026, all articles published by ACM will be Open Access, with most authors potentially not needing to pay Article Processing Charges (APC).
All submissions must adhere to IEEE and ACM policies regarding authorship and generative AI tools.
A temporary subsidy will reduce the APC to $250 for ACM/SIG members and $350 for non-members.
There will be two submission cycles, with the second deadline on July 18, 2025.

summary.conference_expectation: At least one author of an accepted paper must register and present at ICSE 2026.
